fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.condition

Annotation Type RequiredProperty


  • @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface RequiredProperty
    This annotation is used with RequiredProperties and its aim is to provide more options on how to handle required properties.

    This annotation is used to indicate the following information:

    • One of several keys must be present
    • The key must be present with a particular value
    • The key must be present with any value but an excepted one
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      String value
      The property key

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String[] alternatives
      The other property keys that are alternative or aliases of the primary key provided by attribute value().
      String[] excludes
      Indicates which value(s) of the property makes the implementation not usable.
      int flags
      Used in conjunction with pattern() to change the regular expression behavior.
      String is
      Indicates that the property value must be exactly the provided value.
      String pattern
      Indicates that the property value must match the provided regular expression.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        public abstract String value
        The property key
        Returns:
        the required property key

      • is

        public abstract String is
        Indicates that the property value must be exactly the provided value.

        If you want to use a regular expression, use pattern() instead.

        Returns:
        the required property value
        Default:
        ""

      • pattern

        public abstract String pattern
        Indicates that the property value must match the provided regular expression. You can use the attribute flags() to change regular expression behavior. See Pattern and Pattern.compile(String, int) for more information about regular expressions.

        If you want to use a strict value, use is() instead.

        Returns:
        the pattern for the property value
        Default:
        ""

      • flags

        public abstract int flags
        Used in conjunction with pattern() to change the regular expression behavior. See Pattern and Pattern.compile(String, int) for more information about regular expression flags. The available flags are:
        • Pattern.CANON_EQ
        • Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE
        • Pattern.COMMENTS
        • Pattern.DOTALL
        • Pattern.LITERAL
        • Pattern.MULTILINE
        • Pattern.UNICODE_CASE
        • Pattern.UNICODE_CHARACTER_CLASS
        • Pattern.UNIX_LINES

        By default, no flag is applied.

        Returns:
        the flag for the pattern
        Default:
        0

      • excludes

        public abstract String[] excludes
        Indicates which value(s) of the property makes the implementation not usable. For example: 
         @RequiredProperty(value="foo.bar", except="none")
        Means that the property with key foo.bar must be present. If the value of the property is none then it indicates that the implementation can't be used. If the value of the property is anything else then it indicates that the implementation can be used.
        Returns:
        the excluded property values
        Default:
        {}

      • alternatives

        public abstract String[] alternatives
        The other property keys that are alternative or aliases of the primary key provided by attribute value().

        Attributes is(), pattern(), excludes() are common for every alternative. For Example: 

         @RequiredProperty(value="foo.bar", alternatives="foo.baz", is="true")
        Means that the implementation can be used either if the property foo.bar is present and its value is true or if the property foo.baz is present and its value is true.
        Returns:
        the list of alternative property keys
        Default:
        {}
